meanings.definition: To comply with the wishes or ideas of (someone) in order to keep them content.
meanings.sent1: She humoured her little brother by playing his favorite game with him.
meanings.sent2: The teacher humoured the students by allowing them to choose the topic for their project.
meanings.sent3: The cat humoured its owner by pretending to be interested in the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The politician humoured the crowd with promises he had no intention of keeping.
meanings.sent5: He humoured his friend's superstitions to avoid an argument.

meanings.definition: The quality of being amusing or entertaining.
meanings.sent1: His jokes always had a touch of humour that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The movie's humour appealed to a wide audience.
meanings.sent3: The children's book was filled with colourful illustrations and light-hearted humour.
meanings.sent4: Her witty humour brightened up even the dullest of days.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's humour was infectious, spreading laughter throughout the audience.
